text: Thank you, I’ve figured it out now anyway. It wasn’t a hidden module. They had just called it that on a site I was looking at but thank you :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi, is it possible to create a dummy url so my main page is resources and i want a child page called webinars which will have the domain /resources/webinars however I don’t want to create an actual page just the elusion there is one to display results from a custom query
Hey <@U070Q7P0W80>, if you don't have/don't want to create a page, you can easily modify the page url like this.
works like a charm without the need to create dummy pages
Hi <@UJAPS2K4N>, where is this sorry? - I’m fairly new to HubSpot :)
No worries. Just open the desired page and click on settings(below the publish/update button in the top right)

first the settings in the top right( or in the left; it's basically the same)
If the page is not published you can edit the "content slug" right away; if it's already published you have to click on the pen-icon next to the url and edit it. *Note: If the page is published and you change the slug, HubSpot will automatically create a redirect*

Hi <@UJAPS2K4N>, I don’t think I’ve explained myself properly I ’m sorry :/ basically I want the resources pages to maintain the same slug but I need like a dummy tags that I’ve created. I.e webinars, ebooks, but I don’t need to actually have a page for them because my query will generate them on page load

there must be a way

*<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/how-do-I-get-a-quot-HubSpot-CTA-quot-to-adopt-my-theme-s-CSS/td-p/980590|how do I get a "HubSpot CTA" to adopt my theme's CSS?>*
You gotta use the embedded html CTA, all the other ones load in iframes
I took a peek at that, and saw that I could use hubl, but it looks like the only thing I can do with it is make a button? In my case, I need a form popup

Yeah only a button. 

You'll have to either custom code your own popup form or just use the HubSpot CTA and style it with the CTA editor
Am I alone thinking that should be childs play for them to enable inclusion of the main theme stylesheet and/or an option for a sheet location?
Would be kinda silly IMO... then the whole theme CSS would load every time there is a button.
How do I deliver a form to someone other than the default user(s)? <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/how-do-I-route-delivery-of-a-form-submission-to-a-specific-user/td-p/980587>
but you think it would be silly to allow users to specify a specific stylesheet for a form ‘cta’, regardless of length, size, or cache status?
